bug.author: ternaus
bug.description:

'train_accuracy.correct', 'train_accuracy.total', 'val_accuracy.correct', 'val_accuracy.total']) </denchmark-code>
I have elements with keys 'train_accuracy.correct', 'train_accuracy.total', 'val_accuracy.correct', 'val_accuracy.total in the state dict. Which are metrics that are logged during training. If it is a feature - it is a strange feature. Now I need to manually delete them so that I will be able to use the checkpoint with the resnet18 model.

comments.comment: Metric.add_state(..., persistent=False) to fix this, but I agree that True as default is strange
